Tasks

The actual work on hybrid and electric vehicles is done through a variety of different Tasks that are focused on specific topics. Each topic is addressed in a Task, which is managed by an Operating Agent (OA).

  • Ongoing

    Task 1 Information Exchange
    serves as a platform for information exchange among member countries

    Status: Ongoing

    read more

  • closed

    Task 10 Electrochemical Systems
    Task 10’s goal was to advance the state-of-the-art of battery and capacitor science and address issues related to their use in vehicles.

    Status: closed

    read more

  • closed

    Task 11 Electric Cycles
    The objectives of Task 11 were to identify barriers for market penetration of electric cycles and to develop and test ways to overcome these barriers.

    Status: closed

    read more

  • closed

    Task 12 Heavy-Duty Hybrid Vehicles
    aimed to report on the current status of the heavy-duty hybrid vehicles “playing field”.

    Status: closed

    read more

  • closed

    Task 13 Fuel Cell Vehicles
    aimed to report on the current status of the heavy-duty hybrid vehicles “playing field”.

    Status: closed

    read more

  • closed

    Task 14 Market Development of Electric Vehicles: Lessons Learned
    this Task was designed to capture and report important lessons learned in past and new deployments of electric vehicles.

    Status: closed

    read more

  • closed

    Task 15 Plug-in Hybrid Electric Vehicles
    This study focused on PHEVs rather than BEVs. The study examines PHEV powertrains with four separate designs, of which two of these are range extended vehicles.

    Status: closed

    read more

  • closed

    Task 16 Alternatives for Buses
    This study focused on PHEVs rather than BEVs. The study examines PHEV powertrains with four separate designs, of which two of these are range extended vehicles.

    Status: closed

    read more

  • closed

    Task 17 Vehicle Optimization & System Integration
    The scope of work has focused on the participant’s fields of expertise and basically covered the monitoring and analysis of component development and vehicle architecture relative to trends and strategies for EVs progress.

    Status: closed

    read more

  • closed

    Task 18 EV Ecosystems
    The scope of the task is to advance international policy and the design of EV ecosystems

    Status: closed

  • closed

    Task 19 Life Cycle Assessment of EVs
    The purpose of this task was to exchange information among cities around the globe on how to reduce air pollution from road traffic.

    Status: closed

  • closed

    Task 2 Impact of EVs
    Governments need reliable information on the environmental and energy impacts of electric vehicles

    Status: closed

    Task 20 Quick Charging
    Reports on the current status of quick charging technology.

    Status: closed

  • closed

    Task 21 Accelerated Ageing Testing for Li-ion Batteries
    The objective of Task 21 was to conduct an inventory of worldwide efforts used in the development and the application of accelerated testing procedures.

    Status: closed

    read more

  • closed

    Task 22 E-Mobility Business Models
    Task 22 recognises that failure to develop these products and services could delay the growth in markets for EVs and limit adoption to niche applications.

    Status: closed

    read more

  • Ongoing

    Task 23 Light-Electric-Vehicle Parking and Charging Infrastructure
    The aim of Task 23 is to represent the interests of local governments in the standardisation of Light Electric Vehicle system architectures, infrastructure, communications and interchangeable batteries.

    Status: Ongoing

    read more

  • closed

    Task 24 Economic Impact Assessment of E-Mobility
    The objective of the Task is to get a better view on the value chain of electric mobility and the economic potential in the local e-mobility sector in every participating country in Task 24.

    Status: closed

    read more

  • closed

    Task 25 Plug-in Electric Vehicles
    The topics of the task include vehicle energy consumption, component costs, vehicle costs, total cost of ownership (TCO), and market penetration.

    Status: closed

    read more

  • closed

    Task 26 Wireless Power Transfer for EVs
    The topics of the task include vehicle energy consumption, component costs, vehicle costs, total cost of ownership (TCO), and market penetration.

    Status: closed

  • closed

    Task 27 Electrification of Transport Logistics Vehicles (eLogV)
    The topics of the task include vehicle energy consumption, component costs, vehicle costs, total cost of ownership (TCO), and market penetration.

    Status: closed

    read more

  • closed

    Task 28 Home Grids and V2X Technologies
    Task 28 aims to address the technical and economic knowledge gaps including regulatory issues preventing V2X technology to fully deploy.

    Status: closed

    read more

  • Ongoing

    Task 29 Electrified, Connected and Automated Vehicles
    Analyses the potential technological synergies of electrification, connectivity and automation of road vehicles and derive research, development and standardisation need

    Status: Ongoing

    read more

  • Ongoing

    Task 30 Assessment of Environmental Effects of Electric Vehicles
    The aim of Task 30 (2016 – 2020) is to analyse and assess environmental effects of EVs on water, land use, resources and air based on LCA and in cooperation with participating countries in the HEV TCP.

    Status: Ongoing

    read more

  • closed

    Task 31 Fuels and Energy Carriers for Transport
    The objective is to compare current (2016) and future electric and plug-in hybrid vehicles with vehicles running on the conventional motor fuels gasoline and diesel.

    Status: closed

    read more

  • Ongoing

    Task 32 Small Electric Vehicles
    The objective of this task is to promote broader commercialisation, acceptance and further development of SEVs.

    Status: Ongoing

    Task 33 Battery Eletric Buses
    The objective of this task is to promote broader commercialisation, acceptance and further development of SEVs.

    Status: closed

  • Ongoing

    Task 34 Batteries
    Task 34’s goal is to encourage the sharing and dissemination of current information about battery topics of interest to the vehicle community.

    Status: Ongoing

  • Ongoing

    Task 35 Fuel Cell Vehicles
    Aims at supporting a broader commercialization, acceptance and a further development of fuel cell electric vehicles (FCVs).

    Status: Ongoing

  • closed

    Task 36 EV Consumer Adoption and Use
    The task aims to provide a platform to connect stakeholders with researchers working on consumer adoption and use of EVs.

    Status: closed

    read more

  • Ongoing

    Task 37 Extreme Fast Charging
    Task 37 is focussed on the following objectives: investigating station siting – what factors are considered (i.e. space requirements, city centre, community/corridor, etc.);

    Status: Ongoing

    read more

  • Ongoing

    Task 38 Marine Applications (e-Ships)
    Task 38 focuses on overviewing and encouraging the development and deployment of e-Ships, by building and sharing key knowledge on projects, performance, segments and demand.

    Status: Ongoing

    read more

  • Ongoing

    Task 39 Interoperability of e-Mobility Services
    Task 39 will focus on the charging infrastructure and more specifically on the interoperability aspects of e-mobility services like charging of passenger cars in the public and semi-public domain.

    Status: Ongoing

    read more

  • closed

    Task 4 EV Infrastructure
    Governments, electric utilities, and the auto industry needed information about the compatibility, cost, and technical issues related to infrastructure.

    Status: closed

    read more

  • Ongoing

    Task 40 CRM4EV – Critical Raw Materials for Electric Vehicles
    With this projected mass deployment of EVs, attention is drawn to potential supply chain issues for several Critical Raw Materials (CRMs) needed for EV manufacturing.

    Status: Ongoing

    read more

  • Ongoing

    Task 41 Electric Freight Vehicles
    The Task's main objectives are to monitor progress and review relevant aspects for a successful introduction of electric freight vehicles (EFV) into the market.

    Status: Ongoing

    read more

  • closed

    Task 42 Scaling Up EV Markets and EV City Casebook
    Task 42 aims to collect learning and best practice from existing and planned large scale deployments of EVs around the world.

    Status: closed

    read more

  • Ongoing

    Task 43 Vehicle/Grid Integration
    Analysing the challenges identified on the integration of the electric vehicles into our electricity and transport system in order to improve economic and environmental performance.

    Status: Ongoing

    read more

  • Ongoing

    Task 45 Electrified Roadways (E-roads)
    To develop a greater global understanding and awareness of electrified roadways (E-Roads), as well as related technologies developed and deployment activities in the participating countries.

    Status: Ongoing

    read more

    it focused its efforts on those areas where governments are the main actors in research, namely in pre-competitive exploratory research.
